real_time.title: Real-Time Analysis
real_time.description: Configure the models, features, and parameters to extract. Upload your audio and follow the progress of each step in real-time (Interaction Required).

job.title: Job Analysis
job.description: Upload your audio and receive the results by email when the analysis is complete

speech_duration.name: Speech Duration
speech_duration.description:
Calculate how much time each speaker speaks in total. 
 Example: { "speaker_1": 35.2 sec, "speaker_2": 20.1 sec }. 
 Measure the balance of the conversation.

speech_frequency.name: Speech Frequency
speech_frequency.description:
Count the number of speech turns for each speaker. 
 Example: { "speaker_1": 12 turns, "speaker_2": 8 turns }. 
 Who speaks more often.

pause_between_turns.name: Pause Between Turns
pause_between_turns.description:
Calculate the average duration of pauses between one speech and another. 
 Example: { "average_pause": 1.2 sec }. 
 Measure the speed of the conversation.

speech_overlap.name: Speech Overlap
speech_overlap.description:
Calculate the percentage of speech overlap between the two speakers. 
 Example: { "overlap_percentage": 5.3% }. 
 Measure the degree of interruption between the two speakers.

speech_emotions.name: Speech Emotions
speech_emotions.description:
Recognize emotions in speech. 
 Example: { "speaker_1": "happy", "speaker_2": "sad" }. 
 Measure the emotional tone of the conversation.

prosody_variation.name: Prosody Variation
prosody_variation.description: Recognize prosodic variations in speech. People with ASD tend to have a monotonous speech or with atypical intonation variations. Calculate the fundamental frequency (F0) range and variation over time. Identify a flat or excessively variable voice tone.

response_time.name: Response Time
response_time.description:
Calculate the average time between a doctor's question and the patient's response. 
 Example: { "speaker_1 (patient)": 2.1 sec }. 
 Measure the response speed. People with ASD often have longer latencies before responding.

avg_sentence_length.name: Average Sentence Length
avg_sentence_length.description:
Calculate the average sentence length of each speaker. 
 Example: { "speaker_1": 5.2 words, "speaker_2": 4.8 words }. 
 Measure the language complexity. People with ASD tend to use very short or very long sentences.

echolalia_repetition.name: Repetition and Echolalia
echolalia_repetition.description:
Recognize the repetition of words or phrases. 
 Example: { "speaker_1": "30%", "speaker_2": "1%" }. 
 Measure the presence of echolalia. People with ASD tend to repeat words or phrases just heard.

syntactic_complexity.name: Syntactic Complexity
syntactic_complexity.description:
Calculate the syntactic complexity of the sentences of each speaker. 
 Example: { "speaker_1": "complex", "speaker_2": "simple" }. 
 Measure the language complexity. People with ASD tend to use poorly structured or complex sentences.

speech_rate.name: Speech Rate
speech_rate.description:
Calculate the average number of words spoken per second by each speaker. 
 Example: { "speaker_1": 120 wpm, "speaker_2": 100 wpm }. 
 Measure the speech rate. People with ASD tend to speak faster or slower.

articulation_pronunciation.name: Articulation and Pronunciation
articulation_pronunciation.description:
Recognize the presence of pronunciation or articulation errors. 
 Example: { "speaker_1": "0 errors", "speaker_2": "5 errors" }. 
 Measure the clarity of speech. ASD is associated with abnormal variations in formants that make the voice less clear.

pitch_stress.name: Intonation and Vocal Stress
pitch_stress.description:
Recognize the presence of abnormal intonations or vocal stress. 
 Example: { "speaker_1": "normal intonation", "speaker_2": "flat intonation" }. 
 Measure the tonal variation. People with ASD tend to use a flat or excessively variable voice tone.

disfluencies.name: Disfluencies
disfluencies.description:
Calculate the number of disfluencies in the speech of each speaker. 
 Example: { "speaker_1": 5 disfluencies, "speaker_2": 3 disfluencies }. 
 Measure the presence of speech disfluencies. People with ASD tend to have more disfluencies in their speech.

turn_taking_coordination.name: Turn-Taking Coordination
turn_taking_coordination.description:
Calculate the coordination of turn-taking between the two speakers. 
 Example: { "speaker_1": "good coordination", "speaker_2": "poor coordination" }. 
 Measure the coordination of the conversation. People with ASD tend to have difficulty in taking turns.

vocal_energy_modulation.name: Vocal Energy Modulation
vocal_energy_modulation.description:
Calculate the presence of vocal energy modulation in speech. 
 Example: { "speaker_1": "good modulation", "speaker_2": "poor modulation" }. 
 Measure the modulation of the voice. People with ASD tend to have a flat or excessively variable voice tone.

harmonics_to_noise_ratio.name: Harmonics to Noise Ratio
harmonics_to_noise_ratio.description:
Calculate the ratio between harmonics and noise in the speech signal. 
 Example: { "speaker_1": 0.8, "speaker_2": 0.6 }. 
 Measure the clarity of the voice. People with ASD tend to have a lower ratio.

intra_turn_latency.name: Intra-Turn Latency
intra_turn_latency.description:
Calculate the average time between one speaker's turn and the other's. 
 Example: { "speaker_1": 1.2 sec, "speaker_2": 1.5 sec }. 
 Measure the speed of the conversation. People with ASD tend to have longer latencies.

functional_word_frequency.name: Functional Word Frequency
functional_word_frequency.description:
Calculate the frequency of functional words in the speech of each speaker. 
 Example: { "speaker_1": 5%, "speaker_2": 10% }. 
 Measure the language complexity. People with ASD tend to use more or less functional words.

speech_entropy.name: Speech Entropy
speech_entropy.description:
Calculate the entropy of the speech of each speaker. 
 Example: { "speaker_1": 0.8, "speaker_2": 0.6 }. 
 Measure the complexity of the speech. People with ASD tend to have a lower entropy.

pause_duration.name: Pause Duration
pause_duration.description:
Calculate the average duration of pauses in the speech of each speaker. 
 Example: { "speaker_1": 0.5 sec, "speaker_2": 0.3 sec }. 
 Measure the presence of pauses in speech. People with ASD tend to have longer pauses.

rms_energy.name: RMS Energy
rms_energy.description:
Calculate the RMS energy of the speech of each speaker. 
 Example: { "speaker_1": 0.8, "speaker_2": 0.6 }. 
 Measure the energy of the voice. People with ASD tend to have a lower energy.

hnr.name: Harmonics to Noise Ratio (HNR)
hnr.description:
Calculate the ratio between harmonics and noise in the speech signal. 
 Example: { "speaker_1": "HNR high", "speaker_2": "HNR low" }. 
 Measure the clarity of the voice. People with ASD tend to produce atypical vocal sounds or use a monotonous voice tone.

stress_voice.name: Vocal Stress
stress_voice.description:
Recognize the presence of vocal stress in speech. 
 Example: { "speaker_1": "stressed", "speaker_2": "not stressed" }. 
 Measure the presence of vocal stress. People with ASD tend to have a flat or excessively variable voice tone.

energy_modulation.name: Energy Modulation
energy_modulation.description:
Calculate the presence of energy modulation in speech. 
 Example: { "speaker_1": "good modulation", "speaker_2": "poor modulation" }. 
 Measure the modulation of the voice. People with ASD tend to have a flat or excessively variable voice tone.

latency_intra_turn.name: Intra-Turn Latency
latency_intra_turn.description:
Calculate the average time between one speaker's turn and the other's. 
 Example: { "speaker_1": 1.2 sec, "speaker_2": 1.5 sec }. 
 Measure the speed of the conversation. People with ASD tend to have longer latencies.

turn_response_time.name: Turn Response Time
turn_response_time.description:
Calculate the average time between a doctor's question and the patient's response. 
 Example: { "speaker_1 (patient)": 2.1 sec }. 
 Measure the response speed. People with ASD often have longer latencies before responding.

fluency_disfluency.name: Fluency and Disfluency
fluency_disfluency.description:
Recognize the presence of disfluencies in speech. 
 Example: { "speaker_1": "5 disfluencies", "speaker_2": "10 disfluencies" }. 
 Measure the fluency of speech. People with ASD tend to use disfluencies like "uh", "um", "then" or repeat words.

sentence_length_avg.name: Average Sentence Length
sentence_length_avg.description:
Calculate the average sentence length of each speaker. 
 Example: { "speaker_1": 5.2 words, "speaker_2": 4.8 words }. 
 Measure the language complexity. People with ASD tend to use very short or very long sentences.

predictability_entropy.name: Predictability Entropy
predictability_entropy.description:
Calculate the predictability of the speech of each speaker. 
 Example: { "speaker_1": "high", "speaker_2": "low" }. 
 Measure the predictability of speech. People with ASD tend to use very predictable or very unpredictable phrases.

total_speech_duration.name: Total Speech Duration
total_speech_duration.description:
Calculate the total duration of the speech of each speaker. 
 Example: { "speaker_1": 35.2 sec, "speaker_2": 20.1 sec }. 
 Measure the balance of the conversation.

total_tald.name: Total TALD
total_tald.description: Total number of turns in the conversation.

circumstantiality.name: Circumstantiality
circumstantiality.description: Excessive detail and verbosity in speech, with difficulty in getting to the point.

derailment.name: Derailment
derailment.description: Sudden shift from one topic to another without logical connection.

tangentiality.name: Tangentiality
tangentiality.description: Inability to maintain focus on the main topic of conversation.

thought_disassociation.name: Thought Disassociation
thought_disassociation.description: Lack of logical connection between thoughts and ideas.

crosstalk.name: Crosstalk
crosstalk.description: Simultaneous speech of the two speakers.

perseveration.name: Perseveration
perseveration.description: Repetition of the same words or phrases.

verbigeration.name: Verbigeration
verbigeration.description: Repetition of the same words or phrases in a disorganized way.

thought_break.name: Thought Break
thought_break.description: Interruption of the flow of thought.

mannered_speech.name: Mannered Speech
mannered_speech.description: Speech with an artificial or exaggerated tone.

semantic_paraphasia.name: Semantic Paraphasia
semantic_paraphasia.description: Substitution of words with others that are semantically related.

phonemic_paraphasia.name: Phonemic Paraphasia
phonemic_paraphasia.description: Substitution of words with others that are phonemically related.

neologisms.name: Neologisms
neologisms.description: Invention of new words or phrases.

clanging.name: Clanging
clanging.description: Association of words based on sound rather than meaning.

echolalia.name: Echolalia
echolalia.description: Repetition of words or phrases just heard.

restricted_thought.name: Restricted Thought
restricted_thought.description: Difficulty in generating new thoughts or ideas.

thought_inhibition.name: Thought Inhibition
thought_inhibition.description: Difficulty in generating new thoughts or ideas.

thought_initiative_intention_dysfunction.name: Thought Initiative/Intention Dysfunction
thought_initiative_intention_dysfunction.description: Difficulty in initiating or maintaining a conversation.

upload.title: Upload File
upload.description: Upload the audio file of the interview to analyze.
upload.informative:
You can only upload files in the following formats: mp3, wav, aiff, flac, ogg, aac, m4a.
 
 The file cannot be larger than 1 GB. You can upload only 1 file.

diarize.title: Diarization
diarize.selectRole: Select the role of the speakers in the conversation.
diarize.browserDontSupportAudio: Your browser does not support audio.

loader.description: Report generation in progress, upon completion you will be redirected to the detail...
